topic.title: Git Center - an alternative to GitHub
topic.body:
# Git Center - GitHub for ZeroNet
**Git Center** is a decentralized hosting platform for Git repositories. We provide several collaboration features such as bug tracking for every project, and private and public repositories.

## Why Git Center?
Currently **Git Center** is the only repository hosting in ZeroNet. This is like 0git, but better: a full alternative to GitHub.

## Cool! How can I access it?
Full link: [http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/)
Currently you can also use [0sh.bit/?GitCenter](/0sh.bit/?GitCenter)
Domain by @affeali: (Thanks!) [gitcenter.bit](/gitcenter.bit).

1509649171_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2.body:
> [gomzik](#comment_5_1F6BMqittjWUStzUbRXm2kG2GQ3RdBLqFQ): Cool!

> [lerolero](#comment_1_1P8U8Ks4aq9toqBxQK3G9ogfjWpDur12iJ): nice!!!!!

> [akito](#comment_347_1F8omDpXyPsBfd9CBJ91o4Wv1AA2KxqMEY): Good job.

> [james007](#comment_101_1DiRWRFXcVgQQ75cXnAG2pyxxjGo2VaH5): Great job! Looks awesome, and I see the source code for the git center is on git center. Meta!

Thank you!

## Git Center Update

1. Fixed bugs
2. Added "Upload file" feature. You have to press New file, then choose path and commit message, then press Upload and commit button.

> [voland](#comment_2_1ED5kEHUideKw92Ncess5yJmP4T2J5Aeqn): What git branch, connected IDE?

Sorry, I couldn't undestand what you mean by `What git branch`.

> [voland](#comment_4_1ED5kEHUideKw92Ncess5yJmP4T2J5Aeqn): How to create branches?

This would be easy to implement, so I'll try to add it soon.

> [affeali](#comment_2_1HFZzR6sZhBvjpmdXoA1msaVTsPwceD9JB): I added a domain for Git Center: gitcenter.bit.

Thank you!

> [erneraude](#comment_27_1JwPBvZYXLJzrA6YisjpsyTuuieFLCARS6): If I understand it correctly, when I access a repo on GitCenter, I download the zite where it is hosted.But, if I want to clone it (let's say in my ~/projects directory), I'll need to use the git clone command, and will have two versions of the repo on my computer at the same time?

Yes, @krixano is right. Like on GitHub, you also have a server version in ZeroNet. So you don't loose information and don't automatically publish information when you change some file. Instead, you change your local copy and then push/pull.
Whatever ZeroSteem is, I see it uploaded on Git Center, but cannot access it. Can author sign and publish it again?

## Git Center Update

Added stars. Now you can star any repository that is in index (you cannot star private repositories).

> [sirenyc](#comment_168_19sggoAZ4hcorrrfWoFWP9rwfpVsL29cnZ): Who added the domain was the: affeali=)

Changed, thx.

> @parkour86: Also when visiting http://gitcenter.bit/ and clicking any of the repos in the index it brings me to a page that says not found. http://gitcenter.bit/1Ps8mZHcKGdwtjmMLBJ9b8KU6ogEBrjEig
> It works find when I visit the site using http://zero/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t and clicking any of the links. It redirects me to http://zero/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?1Ps8mZHcKGdwtjmMLBJ9b8KU6ogEBrjEig

That's a problem because of `http://gitcenter.bit` prefix, and Git Center relies on `http://.../gitcenter.bit`. I'll try to fix this soon.
@axeltherabbit You made EulerFinder, right? I see your repository is corrupted: it has zero-length filenames. How did you manage to do that?

> [axeltherabbit](#comment_32_1CGweCTCsFxD5FjvciBaGagZXsAUbXustF): i think during the attempts of trying the file upload feature

Could you please try to reproduce it? The only bug I see now is that setting filename to `/abc` creates a zero-length directory with `abc` file inside, but that's not the problem with EulerFinder repo, obviously.

> [kopyjane](#comment_48_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGNRLFcE): Test two... http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?18bHRBuU7n78AjBPYk1bpjVJx4tipvErm1/@master

HOW? I mean, how did you manage to create empty-name directories?

> [kopyjane](#comment_51_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGNRLFcE): That was my screw up. I accidentally typed /css instead of css/

:) Please post this as issue to Git Center Source. Trying to fix that...

> [parkour86](#comment_10_1EXv9ZukJjnSeYBijEBwFZZNBdEzEvvs9M): Feature Request: Right now files are sorted alphabetically under Root>. I'd like to see directories sorted first then all other files sorted second.

Done. First, submodules are shown, then directories, then files.

> [kopyjane](#comment_51_17ffrcHNzbFoUe81PyMEagQdv2DGNRLFcE): That was my screw up. I accidentally typed /css instead of css/

Could you please fix this or somehow let me do that?

## Git Center Update

1. Add user muting (on settings page)
2. Some minor fixes
3. Remove **Git Center Status** - no need in it since I use ZeroMe, ZeroTalk and ZeroMail
4. Sort file list - first submodules (they are supported, yes!), then directories and finally files.

Any ideas how to parse Mercurial deltas? [Mercurial and Fossil VCS Support? ](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/0@12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu)
Any ideas what features to add to Git Center?

> [roninx](#comment_8_1ALwbRLVTnHkqz8mCtWrHV1AsZLFkRhJj2): Private repo?

You can create a repository (which means create a new zite, in fact) and don't add it to repository index. Then it will be somewhat private.

> [roninx](#comment_9_1ALwbRLVTnHkqz8mCtWrHV1AsZLFkRhJj2): When I click "sign and publish" it prompts "content publish failed". Is it due to the port 15441 closing? I can't manage to open that port tho.

That means your repository has no peers. That's OK when your repo is private.

## Git Center Update

1. Show usernames in NewsFeed
2. Show only owned repos in `My Repos`
3. Show repository owner
4. Diff view for commits

Working on Mercurial support now!

> [binchan2](#comment_43_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h): That's fast! Good job!

Thank you!

> [binchan2](#comment_44_1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h): I just finished adding dark theme support for jsdiff :D

Looks nice!

## Git Center Update

Not such a big feature, but just added issue/PR mentioning!

[This news at ZeroMe](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/1512831957)

## Git Center Update

Brought to my attention by @空澄砂夜: aka Sorasumi Sayo. Added `[ ]` / `[x]` / `[v]` checkboxes support in markdown by [commit c73bead](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/commit/?18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/c73bead539eecffe33908bade25368aaa6326652).

Not editable by clicking yet, if you have any ideas how to implement that, post issue to Git Center repository.

---

Example from [|><||>](/15Z4H5K8YxjqGWpPxMLHWwr6Ve2nR7dz8d) repository: [on ZeroMe](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/1513005011).

> [tau0](#comment_1_19b8dupChmu8SXVT7GbHU4gQN8qaH34d25): How i set up the git remote ?

> [krixano](#comment_246_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu): git remote add [name] [link]

Example: `git remote add zeronet ~/Documents/ZeroNet/data/repositoryaddress/myfirstrepository.git`.

Where `~/Documents/ZeroNet/data` is path to data folder and you can find `repositoryaddress/myfirstrepository.git` when clicking `Clone` on repository page.

## Git Center Update

1. Show actions like closing/reopening issue/PR.
2. Follow actions in newsfeed.
3. Editing and comments and issues!
4. Add and remove tags and follow changes in newsfeed.

[Screenshot](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1SunAWK2VUT9GQK32MpwRfFPVgcBSJN9a/1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/1513516312)

8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj.body: @nofish, could you please upload ZeroNet to [Git Center](/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1509649171_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di/Git+Center+an+alternative+to+GitHub) ?

> [piloth](#comment_11_1FKuNsExQML7APuNmkCV8uzB5pKupcmnck): How do you make a post sticky? Thanks in advance :)

Only forum administrator can do that. If you are admin, you can edit `content.json` of your site. You will find:

```
"settings": {
  "admin": "nofish",
  "admin_href": "http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=nofish",
  "topic_sticky_uris": ["2_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj", "8_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj"]
 },
```

Replace that with:

```
"settings": {
  "admin": "piloth",
  "admin_href": "http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/?to=piloth",
  "topic_sticky_uris": ["topic_id", "topic_id", "topic_id", "topic_id"] // replace this
 },
```
@nofish: Could you please raise my limit?

You can try:
1. Use [corsPermission](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Docsfk5uLvuXkL4U13eYDxCm2gzi1fNQq/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/index.html#corsPermission) ZeroFrame command, then you can use `http://127.0.0.1:43110/your_site/cors-other_site/other_site_data`.
2. Use `raw` prefix (recommended): `http://127.0.0.1:43110/raw/other_site/other_site_data`.

1512651955_1GSZKHqdkmnBZHy1FUXbq2PQT4hHD.body:
You don't have to open it. For sharing, ZeroNet has two possibilities:

1. `Publish`: `site owner -> "publish" -> peer` (peer has to open port, site owner doesn't)
2. `Update`: `peer -> "update" -> site owner` (peer doesn't have to open port, site owner does)

So, your sites should work even with port closed.

> [spaghetti](#comment_2_1GSZKHqdkmnBZHy1FUXbq2PQT4hHD1ZQHj): I mean, seeding sites (that I do not own). Basically, I want to support the network.

Then you don't have to leave port open.

> [nofish](#comment_1072_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): You can, allowed chars: [a-z[]() A-Z0-9_@=.+-/], but the file name is too long (max 255 char)

My bad, forgot about this again.

Then, maybe raise error with message `Too long inner_path` instead?

1513249597_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77W.body:
> [polar](#comment_84_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): cmdp looks good, where can I use it?

If your site is old, you can copy `zeroframe.js` from `ZeroHello/template-new/js/ZeroFrame.js`. If your site is new, you already have it.

> [polar](#comment_84_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): cmdp looks good, where can I use it?

If you have a simple site or have your own library, of course you can use `cmdp`. But ZeroNet API is weird somewhere, so I suggest you to look at my libraries or take some code from them. (example: all files are read correctly except *some* binary. WebSocket hangs. Ya know what? That file had some bytes which turned out to be some websocket termination code. I had to add base64 parse/encode functions)

Though [Krixano thought about it](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/12h51ug6CcntU2aiBjhP8Ns2e5VypbWWtv/12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6nvuBPu/1513049503), I am not sure, maybe you both should try to do that and we'll have 3 social networks.

1513227488_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77W.body: Which sites are you seeding then?

1513261976_14AGYi4egYjHjzXwWezZ3LVd8KRwQ.body:
## Part 1. Find `data`

First of all, you should find your `data` folder.

1. If you use Windows stand-alone ZeroNet (that is from zeronet.io, `zeronet-win-dist`), then you will find `data` near `ZeroNet.exe`.
2. If there is `python.exe` in ZeroNet folder, you will find `data` near it.
3. Otherwise, if you set up ZeroNet on Windows, e.g. in `C:\Program Files\ZeroNet`, then you will find `data` folder in `C:\Program Files\ZeroNet\data`.
4. If you use MacOS and put ZeroNet to `Applications`, then you will find `data` folder here: `~/Library/Application Support/ZeroNet/data`. If you didn't put ZeroNet to `Applications`, then `data` will be near `zeronet.py` and others.
5. If you use AppImage, `usr/share` or other non-writable locations, you would normally find `data` in `~/ZeroNet/data`.

## Part 2. Find site address

When visiting a site, you will usually see `http://127.0.0.1:43110/1something` in address bar. That `1something` is site address. If you see `.bit` there or can't find out what to copy: open site, then open sidebar, then find `SITE ADDRESS` entry.

## Part 3. Open directory

Locate to `data` folder. Then open a folder named like site address. This will be your site.

## Part 4. What is here?

Here is `index.html` which is usual `index.html`, like on ClearNet. You can simply edit it (hint: don't use absolute paths on ZeroNet) and add/remove other files. Then open sidebar, press `Sign` and then `Publish` at the very bottom to sign the site. After signing (do it after each change), peers will get new updates.

---

Also, you may want to check out my tutorials here: https://github.com/krixano/ZeroNet-Dev-Center/issues/28. There is information that you will find useful when you try to make a new site.

1513268056_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77W.body: Just posted answer [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1513261976_14AGYi4egYjHjzXwWezZ3LVd8KRwQArDLd). As stated, navigate to `data/1something` via some file explorer.

> [james007](#comment_134_1DiRWRFXcVgQQ75cXnAG2pyxxjGo2VaH5): He may mean cross-Zites. Like the Merged:CDN thing, was never clear to me either.

A tutorial on merger sites can be found here: https://github.com/krixano/ZeroNet-Dev-Center/issues/28. You need parts 11 and 12.

> [polar](#comment_85_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): I am developing http://127.0.0.1:43110/1QHbf72f4vdx3QAxN1LTN9KP19J428Q85R.I mean move files by ZeroFrame API, and not load whole file data into memory.If can't, I will use bash/python.

1513544848_18zH6Av8AX7XdEW9PNFeb8QCs4QdM.body:
> We did not set that when we changed the site address to our vanity address.

Maybe you did it wrong?

Steps:
1. Create an empty site (and maybe fill it with some content)
2. Generate new vanity address <- you are here
3. Rename folder of your site to that new address
4. (optional) Add private key to `users.json`, I can explain it further if you want
5. Visit new site using new address (http://127.0.0.1:43110/new_address)
6. Sign and publish it

I tried that a lot of times and that worked.

> [malteaser](#comment_7_18zH6Av8AX7XdEW9PNFeb8QCs4QdMTVaYB): Could be, though we followed those steps except for step 4. We also modified content.json to add the vvanity address: [...]

I didn't change `address_index` when I created Git Center, so it shouldn't matter.

> [malteaser](#comment_7_18zH6Av8AX7XdEW9PNFeb8QCs4QdMTVaYB): Could be, though we followed those steps except for step 4. We also modified content.json to add the vvanity address: [...]

Did you clone any site or created new?

> [malteaser](#comment_9_18zH6Av8AX7XdEW9PNFeb8QCs4QdMTVaYB): Cloned. We also did other test clones without changing the vanity address and got the same result.

What ZeroNet version do you have?

1513607828_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77W.body:
> [polar](#comment_88_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): I need the built-in feature. And git is low-performance for HUGE amount of files.

Builtin? You mean, ZeroNet? Then, there is no such feature.

Though, there may be a service in ZeroNet that offers it, but not builtin.

> [polar](#comment_89_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): A great example: https://wiki.installgentoo.com/index.php/Lainchan [...]

GitHub owners can erase all data, too. Do you know a service which has no problems?

> [polar](#comment_90_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): But we have clone, right?

Which one?

> [polar](#comment_91_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): Normal git.If a git repo erase all data and push to remote server, we still have local copy.

What stops you from using Git for ZeroNet?

> [polar](#comment_92_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): No, I can use git on my site. But I want apply this feature on all site.

So you basically want a backup system?

> [polar](#comment_94_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6): I don't use time-based job scheduler. Full-scan / full-copy all file in /data is low-performance.I monitor file change: when file change, I copy the changed file to mirror folder, and mirror folder stored all old version of files since I start seeding) [...]

In git, you can force-push. You can deny force-push, but only on remote server. On ZeroNet, there is no server. So you cannot forbid anybody to force-push.

1513455571_1PyrAjbZiHyfW7jSWeUpDPSeMU7sA.body:
> [lonelyreader](#comment_9_1PyrAjbZiHyfW7jSWeUpDPSeMU7sAJ5HSs): If I would somehow choose the shorten link, it would be perfect

What about [0sh.bit/?GitCenter](/0sh.bit/?GitCenter)? :)

So that's how I did this:
1. Open folder of 0sh. (ZeroNet/data/1GNTAKCimBv5xEnt7QvkDn8sTkEPj7ZYTL)
2. Get your ZeroID auth_address (go to zeroid.bit, slide sidebar, notice `UNIQUE ADDRESS`)
3. Go to `0shfolder/data/uniqueaddress/data.json`.
4. Replace link you were given to what you want (`GitCenter` is what I used)
